metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: Sorry. Was lost in thought... something the matter?
4.context: NodeContext: A little distracted. Something on her mind.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: You first, what's on your mind?

314.speaker: Shadowheart
314.text: I don't fully know... just a nagging feeling. Almost like I'm conflicted about something, but I don't quite know what.
314.context: NodeContext: Vaguely troubled/struggling to articulate something.

170.speaker: Shadowheart
170.text: It's nothing, forget it. Too much time in my own head.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: There were a few things I wanted to talk about...

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Do you really need to ask?
67.context: NodeContext: brief flare of temper.Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

142.speaker: Shadowheart
142.text: I'm sorry. I have a lot on my mind... the Shadowfell, Nightsong... I can think of little else.
142.context: NodeContext: Composing herself after a brief outburst. Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: With good reason. It is no coincidence that a daughter of the Moonmaiden spoke to you of wolves.

286.speaker: Shadowheart
286.text: That's not the first time you've made such a leap.

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: Maybe I shouldn't be entirely shocked - I did fall for a Selûnite, after all.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: But perhaps there's more to it than I know - or would care to admit.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: The Moonmaiden's daughter will provide the answers you need. I am sure of it.

347.speaker: Player
347.text: Nightsong will be able to give you answers, when the time comes.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: We'll just have to keep going, and see what lies ahead.

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: I suppose you're right... there's nothing more I can do just yet.

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: I don't know. Maybe it's a Selûnite trick, or another way for Lady Shar to test my faith.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: You're too quick to find excuses for Shar. She turned on you.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Nightsong... she mentioned your fear of wolves, just like you shared with me. That's no coincidence.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: That's more true than you may have intended. I'm not sure I am the same person I was before.
74.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: The Shadowheart I thought I was would never have even dreamed of defying the Lady Shar. I'm a stranger to myself.
24.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: The sooner I speak to Nightsong, the sooner I'll know what the future holds for me - assuming I have a future at all.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Snap out of it. You made a choice, now live with it.

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: I'm trying. But I need answers. I need to know what happened in the Shadowfell wasn't for nothing,

329.speaker: Player
329.text: Perhaps you should try to appease Shar. She may forgive you.

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: Forgiveness? No, I don't think so. Part of me hopes that this is another test, or that there is some way to earn my way back into the Dark Lady's graces.
31.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

66.speaker: Shadowheart
66.text: But I felt her anger. There's no point in denying this is real.
66.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: Nightsong has some explaining to do...

365.speaker: Shadowheart
365.text: Yes, I'm counting on it - I have little else to turn to.
365.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: I need you focused, Shadowheart. There's a lot still at stake.

194.speaker: Shadowheart
194.text: I know, it's just... hard to look past this. I feel like a huge part of me is missing. And worse still, I feel I cut it out, myself.
194.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

284.speaker: Player
284.text: Thank you, for saving a daughter of Selûne.

326.speaker: Shadowheart
326.text: Don't thank me. I didn't do it for her. I'm not even sure I did it for me.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: I'm here for you, if you need me. I thought you might have needed reminding, after everything.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I'm here for you, if you need me. I thought you might have needed reminding, after everything.

211.speaker: Shadowheart
211.text: Thank you. I think any attempts at comforting me might be in vain just now... but you're sweet to keep me in your thoughts.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: The shadow curse - does it affect you now?

195.speaker: Shadowheart
195.text: Same as anyone. Lady Shar's blessings... they're gone.
195.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: There's some matters I wanted to discuss.

190.speaker: Shadowheart
190.text: I'm sorry. It might be best kept until later. I'd be a poor counsel and worse company just now.
190.context: NodeContext: A little distant, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I need you to stay here in camp for now.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I need you to stay at camp for now.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: For the best, perhaps. More difficult for me to ruin things if I just keep out of the way.
11.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

161.speaker: Shadowheart
161.text: I'm afraid you're stuck with me for the moment - I can't reach camp just now.
161.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

297.speaker: Shadowheart
297.text: You'll need to make some room for me first - seems like you have ample company already.
297.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: When the chance arises, I must speak to Nightsong again. Whatever she claims to know... It may just help me make sense of everything.
13.context: NodeContext: A little subdued, preoccupied . Arc: SH has recently defied Shar by not killing Nightsong. Now she's processing the fact that she's been banished by her goddess, and will remain in this slump until she speaks to Nightsong again to learn more about herself.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: It just so happens I have one right here.

266.speaker: Shadowheart
266.text: Oh hells, you didn't pick that by hand did you? They're deadly poisonous!
266.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed with alarmNodeContext: wide-eyed alarm

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: Joking. They're safe - and beautiful. Thank you.

303.speaker: Shadowheart
303.text: I don't have anything to give you in return, I'm afraid.

346.speaker: Player
346.text: I'm sure you'll come up with something, in time.

353.speaker: Shadowheart
353.text: We'll see. Give me a while to put my imagination to work.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: It's just a token. I don't expect anything in return.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.text: Well, perhaps I can come up with something later, all the same.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Well I'd better take it back, then.

241.speaker: Shadowheart
241.text: Ahem, no you shall not. I'd hate to reward a kind gesture by breaking your fingers. Give me some time - I'll see if there's a way I can make it up to you.

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.text: Come on, that's not a question you ask for no reason - what are you hiding?

125.speaker: Player
125.text: A night orchid - here, take it.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: A night orchid - my favourite. One of the few things I can actually remember clearly. They're not exactly common; perhaps finding one is a good omen.

83.speaker: Shadowheart
83.text: Difficult to say - a fellow servant of the Nightsinger would surely be an ally to me under most circumstances... but something doesn't add up. I'll need to see where his allegiances truly lie.
83.context: NodeContext: Unsure/not willing to go all in just yet. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: These lands may not be under the thrall of Lady Shar for much longer.
93.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Arc: Shadowheart has committed to Shar

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: No matter. She wished for Ketheric Thorm to be punished, and he has been. Her darkness was a blessing offered before he betrayed her. She can redirect her powers elsewhere.
53.context: NodeContext: Bullish. 'it's all part of my goddess's plan' Arc: Shadowheart has committed to Shar

130.speaker: Shadowheart
130.text: No matter. She wishes for Ketheric Thorm to be punished... Her darkness was a blessing offered before he betrayed her. She can redirect her powers elsewhere once he is cast down.
130.context: NodeContext: Bullish. 'it's all part of my goddess's plan' Arc: Shadowheart has committed to Shar

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: A necessary sacrifice, so that I can press onwards. The Dark Lady will understand, surely.
86.context: NodeContext: Bullish. 'it's all part of my goddess's plan' Arc: Shadowheart has committed to Shar

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: These lands will soon be free of Shar's grasp. You can almost sense it.
116.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart has turned from Shar

239.speaker: Shadowheart
239.text: If I was a bard, I might be tempted to draw comparisons between nature and myself both shaking off Shar... but luckily for you, I'm no bard.
239.context: NodeContext: Wry. Arc: Shadowheart has turned from Shar

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: I've been lied to, my whole life. And I was gullible enough to just believe it.
118.context: NodeContext: A lot to process, emotionally. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar. Shortly beforehand, Nightsong revealed the truth about her past.

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: The Shadow Curse... it doesn't seem to affect me like it does others. Not as badly, at least.

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: That 'almost' is doing a great deal of heavy lifting. That man changes allegiances more frequently than a courtesan changes her bedsheets.

131.speaker: Shadowheart
131.text: At least he's proof you can turn from Shar and live to tell the tale. Though some may not call that living...
131.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar

361.speaker: Shadowheart
361.text: He betrayed Lady Shar. There can be no forgiveness for that.
361.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.context: NodeContext: Brave face/touch of nerves. She's revealing a new hairstyle to the player, in the image of shar (arc: Shar path, SH has sacrificed Nightsong)

312.speaker: Shadowheart
312.text: This hairstyle is closer to Lady Shar's own image. I did it to honour her... what do you think?
312.context: NodeContext: Brave face/touch of nerves. She's revealing a new hairstyle to the player, in the image of shar (arc: Shar path, SH has sacrificed Nightsong)

288.speaker: Shadowheart
288.text: Good. I did this for Lady Shar, for myself... but I had hoped you'd like it as well.

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: Have you ever considered entering into politics? You've some form with giving non-answers.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Not for me. But this isn't about me.

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: Honest of you. And you're right - this is about me, and how I can best serve Lady Shar.
334.context: NodeContext: Grudging respect. Player admitted they don't like her new hair.

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: Last Light is no more. Lady Shar's darkness will have swept away all resistance, thanks to my sacrifice.
189.context: NodeContext: Shar path. Taken aback. Perhaps not entirely sure if this is a good thing or not.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You're saying Nightsong's death condemned Last Light...?

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: Last Light was shielded by Selûnite magic. Perhaps when the Nightsong died, the Moon Witch was grieved - distracted. Her blessings may have wavered.
81.context: NodeContext: Conjecture. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

331.speaker: Shadowheart
331.text: Still, though... I wonder if there's more to it. Surely they could have held out at the inn for at least a while... unless they, too, felt Nightsong's passing.
331.context: NodeContext: Conjecture. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: I didn't know this would happen...

186.speaker: Shadowheart
186.text: Neither did I... but I can hazard a guess, with hindsight.
186.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback. Some people may have died indirectly because she did what her goddess bid her to.

270.speaker: Shadowheart
270.text: I don't recall you stopping me - you had every opportunity.
270.context: NodeContext: Defensive. Some people may have died indirectly because she did what her goddess bid her to.

260.speaker: Shadowheart
260.text: Besides, they put themselves in harm's way, then were arrogant enough to try and withstand the Nightsinger's power instead of fleeing. You can't help those who aren't willing to help themselves.
260.context: NodeContext: Indignant justification. Some people may have died indirectly because she did what her goddess bid her to.

122.speaker: Shadowheart
122.text: It matters little, either way. Lady Shar claims everything, in the end. Last Light is a testament to that.
122.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: Silently pray for those lost. Urge the Moonmaiden to guide their spirits to her light.

290.speaker: Shadowheart
290.text: Take a moment, if you need it. I didn't know this would happen - truly.
290.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Doesn't regret what she did, but regrets that it upset her love interest/respected player

192.speaker: Shadowheart
192.text: What, are you praying to Selûne? Somehow I don't think she's listening to her followers, just now.
192.context: NodeContext: Tough words hiding some disquiet. Some people may have died indirectly because she did what her goddess bid her to.

191.speaker: Shadowheart
191.text: Yes... but also no. I felt like the world had been upended, but it also made perfect sense.
191.context: NodeContext: A lot to process, emotionally. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar

362.speaker: Shadowheart
362.text: My parents are alive, and I have to save them. I think a part of me always knew that - a part that Shar denied to me.
362.context: NodeContext: A lot to process, emotionally. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar

249.speaker: Player
249.text: Whatever you must do, I will be by your side.

275.speaker: Shadowheart
275.text: Thank you, but I want you to refrain from foolish heroics - when the time comes, we will be entering a nest of vipers. I couldn't bear to lose you. Not after everything.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: The Moonmaiden is still there to guide you, no matter how long you have been lost.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: That may be so, but this is something I need to do myself. You'll have to forgive me if I'm a little wary of goddesses just now.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Dare I suggest... Shar may have had her reasons?

198.speaker: Shadowheart
198.text: Not if you enjoy having your head attached to your neck. She stole my family from me. She stole my life. Whatever reason she has isn't good enough.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: You've been forced to live a lie. At least now the truth is starting to reveal itself.

134.speaker: Shadowheart
134.text: Indeed, but the truth may yet prove painful. Who knows what Shar still keeps from me.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: We'd better press on for now, and hope we're ready when the moment comes.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: But before that... there's one thing I need to see to.

227.speaker: Shadowheart
227.text: You'll see for yourself soon enough. Just leave it with me.

357.speaker: Shadowheart
357.text: I intend to. I've wasted enough time serving others.

263.speaker: Shadowheart
263.text: No. It's nothing that can do any harm. Simply... a gesture. But an important one.

304.speaker: Shadowheart
304.text: We need to get to Baldur's Gate, first of all.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: You have a lot on your mind, but we have to stay focused. The Absolute is still a threat.

236.speaker: Shadowheart
236.text: I know. One crisis at a time, eh? Still, I must see this done, when the moment arises.

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.text: Is that so? Well I hope you don't intend to make such a claim without some evidence to support it.
196.context: NodeContext: A little defensive, yet willing to hear the player out.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: The wound on your hand - it seemed to pain you for being merciful to animals.

272.speaker: Shadowheart
272.text: Lady Shar does not see mercy as a virtue, even to simple creatures...
272.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Kindness is a virtue for most... but that wound on your hand almost seems to punish you for how you are with animals.

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: It may just be a coincidence, but yes... sometimes it feels like any stirring of affection is rewarded with sheer agony.
127.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

258.speaker: Player
258.text: You kept the night orchid. Would the Lady of Loss approve? Surely you should let go...

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Perhaps not... but it's difficult to surrender something so beautiful...
39.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

305.speaker: Shadowheart
305.text: I'll admit it, staying true to Lady Shar has proved difficult at times. I've found that my mind is prone to wandering.
305.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: Wandering to places I shouldn't go, at that. Forbidden thoughts, hidden memories... all that Lady Shar would shield me from, until I am ready.
8.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: Sometimes it feels like there's something just out of reach. Some truth, on the tip of my tongue. And at times, I feel like I can almost voice it.
106.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: When I ate the noblestalk, I remembered I had a friend. But all I have is a name, and a face. There must be more...
30.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

216.speaker: Shadowheart
216.text: Nothing is simple anymore. Sometimes it feels like all I have are doubts.
216.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: The way you're feeling is just temporary. You'll soon forget all about it.

128.speaker: Shadowheart
128.text: I suppose I'm adept at that. I just need to shut out all distractions, focus on what Lady Shar demands of me.
128.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: These doubts... where do you think they stem from?

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: The Mother Superior must have had a reason to deny me the chance to become a Dark Justiciar... perhaps this is the reason? Perhaps I'm simply not worthy.
58.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: Forget I ever said anything. I'm just indulging in thoughts best buried.
87.context: NodeContext: Trying to shake off lingering disquiet.

358.speaker: Shadowheart
358.text: That's what concerns me... I don't know. Perhaps there's something about me, waiting to be discovered. Something I won't like.

325.speaker: Player
325.text: Everyone has doubts. You're not special.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Perhaps you should listen to those doubts. A part of you may wish to change your ways...

243.speaker: Shadowheart
243.text: Are you sure you aren't just voicing your wishes for me?

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Doubt requires awareness. Awareness will lead to wisdom, enlightenment. Embrace your doubts - make them strengths.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: Huh. That was... actually rather comforting. Thank you.

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.text: When I shared the memory from my childhood, you found it far too easy to make a connection to Selûne for my liking.
171.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

339.speaker: Shadowheart
339.text: I've always felt like I owed Lady Shar my life... but what came before? Why was I in those woods?
339.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

320.speaker: Shadowheart
320.text: Thinking about my wound... it can't just be random, how it torments me. Surely there's a pattern, a purpose...
320.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: The wound on your hand - it's been paining you quite a lot lately.

50.speaker: Shadowheart
50.text: The pain is something I can handle. Well... most of the time.
50.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: You've been acting differently at camp. Praying less, pacing more. Something's bothering you.

265.speaker: Shadowheart
265.text: True prayer needs peace. And serenity has proved elusive of late...
265.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: I thought you'd have been more preoccupied with finding a Sharran stronghold.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I thought you'd have been more focused on trying to prove yourself to Shar.

316.speaker: Shadowheart
316.text: Normally, I'd tell you you're just reading too much into things. But, well...
316.context: NodeContext: Wrestling with her beliefs a little, though she's struggling to articulate it fully. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: I don't know. You seem a little less focused on your mission, perhaps.

215.speaker: Shadowheart
215.text: I've done it. I've actually done it. A Dark Justiciar, chosen by Lady Shar. It almost doesn't feel real...

244.speaker: Shadowheart
244.text: The long-overdue death of Ketheric Thorm.
244.context: NodeContext: Determined. Goddess has given her her next task. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

95.speaker: Shadowheart
95.text: I must continue to prove myself worthy of her favour. The apostate Ketheric Thorm still lives. That will soon change, if I have any say in the matter.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I'm glad you got what you wanted.

337.speaker: Shadowheart
337.text: Not as glad as I am.
337.context: NodeContext: Proud. Has proven herself to her goddess. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Even your Mother Superior couldn't prevent you from realising your dream.

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: Well, it appears my days of seeking her approval are at an end.

324.speaker: Player
324.text: Shar's power will soon wane in these lands...

268.speaker: Shadowheart
268.text: Just my luck to enter a place where Lady Shar's power holds sway, only to find a Selûnite stronghold in its midst.
268.context: NodeContext: Miffed. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

308.speaker: Shadowheart
308.text: That cleric, Isobel - she seems almost impressive, in a perverse sort of way. I didn't think anyone could resist Lady Shar's power like she does.
308.context: NodeContext: Grudging respect for Isobel, a selunite she met.  Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

344.speaker: Shadowheart
344.text: And please - the less said about her blessing, the better. That was for your benefit, and to keep the peace.
344.context: NodeContext: Wince of embarassment at the thought.  Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

257.speaker: Shadowheart
257.context: NodeContext: Firm. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: You handled it well, I thought.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: You think so? Thank you. I felt meek, like I'd failed the Dark Lady... but it's important to choose the right time to fight her battles.
49.context: NodeContext: Grateful/a little unsure of herself.  Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: Selûnite presence here is an affront to Lady Shar, but this is not the time to do anything about it. We have bigger concerns.
140.context: NodeContext: Being strategic.  Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I was concerned things might end poorly.

129.speaker: Shadowheart
129.text: Perhaps they might have done, if I was a lesser servant of the Nightsinger - one given to rash action.
129.context: NodeContext: Being strategic.  Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Your goddess won't be pleased. You accepted the blessings of her rival.

99.speaker: Shadowheart
99.text: Pleased? Hardly. I felt the bite of the wound right after the moon witch's influence was forced upon me.
99.context: NodeContext: Scornful. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

291.speaker: Shadowheart
291.text: Yet it was just a reminder of who I truly serve. I am still loyal to Lady Shar, and she will still offer me protection from some of her power.
291.context: NodeContext: Reasoning with herself. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Whatever the circumstances, I am glad you allowed some of the Moonmaiden's light to shine on you.

267.speaker: Shadowheart
267.text: Allowed? More like tolerated. But I thought it wiser to swallow my misgivings and keep focused.
267.context: NodeContext: Scornful. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar

340.speaker: Shadowheart
340.text: That blessing you accepted - Lady Shar won't like it, but I have to hope she'll understand it was a necessary evil.
340.context: NodeContext: Some concern/trying to square a circle. Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: She may have offered me some protection from her shadows, but that doesn't extend to you. Easier for me to serve her if I still have you at my side.
155.context: NodeContext: Being strategic.  Arc: SH is loyal to Shar.

274.speaker: Shadowheart
274.text: A night orchid - remember I told you they were my favourite? I'm lucky to have found one - perhaps it's a good omen for us.

287.speaker: Shadowheart
287.text: He's trouble - worse, he's a traitor. Whatever loyalty he had towards Lady Shar is long gone. It would please her greatly to see him meet his long-overdue end, I'll wager.
287.context: NodeContext: Some contempt towards the person she's discussing - a onetime paladin of shar who changed allegiances. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

332.speaker: Shadowheart
332.text: I... I thought I was done for. I thought perhaps I might have been dead.
332.context: NodeContext: Shaken. Speaking shortly after she's been ostracised by Shar for defying her.

245.speaker: Shadowheart
245.text: This... this is all like some sort of terrible dream. But it's real, isn't it? I stood before the Nightsong. I heard Lady Shar's words... and I failed her.

277.speaker: Shadowheart
277.text: Worse than failed her - I defied her. Just because of what that aasimar said.

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: I tried to leave... but Shar blocked me. Punished me for failing her. I thought I knew the limit of pain that the incurable wound could inflict, but I had no idea.

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: It felt like I was suffering the agony of a thousand people, all at once. My blood was boiling, my hair was on fire. I thought I'd claw my own face off with the pain...

144.speaker: Shadowheart
144.text: But then she released me - banished me more like. She said I was an outcast, that all of her children would know me and revile me. I'm alone.

217.speaker: Narrator
217.text: *Shadowheart looks distraught - abandoned by her goddess and all former allies. And as for her divine magic...? Admitting who empowers her now may break her spirit for good.*

336.speaker: Shadowheart
336.context: NodeContext: Quietly emptional/appreciative post-hug. Speaking shortly after she's been ostracised by Shar for defying her.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You're not alone. You have me.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: I suppose I do, don't I? You've done more to help me than my faith has in recent times, if I'm honest. Thank you.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: There's been something between us for some time. A connection, more than friends... I recognised it, but didn't act on it.

253.speaker: Shadowheart
253.text: I thought my faith was the most important thing in my life - I couldn't have been more wrong.

107.speaker: Shadowheart
107.text: I've squandered too much time already. I want to be with you. Now and always. Do you want the same?

319.speaker: Player
319.text: I do. I've wanted this for a long time.

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: It wasn't too long ago that I could never imagine smiling again... shows what I know.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I'm sorry... I don't feel the same way as you do. There's no future for us. Not like that.

210.speaker: Shadowheart
210.text: Oh... then I'm sorry to have put you on the spot. Clearly I've a habit of seeking love in all the wrong places...

176.speaker: Player
176.text: You made your choice. Now you'll have to live with it.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: Live with it? For a time, at least. Anyone who bows to the Dark Lady could turn on me the moment they see me. I'm a target.

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: Nightsong promised she'd tell me something about myself. I need to speak with her as soon as I can.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: What she said to me back in the Shadowfell, about the wolves... that's no coincidence.

148.speaker: Shadowheart
148.text: She took flight to hunt down Ketheric Thorm. All I can do is help hasten his demise, and hope that answers soon follow.
148.context: NodeContext: Shaken, vulnerable, Trying to orientate herself towards what's next

114.speaker: Player
114.text: We're all alone in the end. Unless you count the tadpole.

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: Heh. Thank you. You're a constant source of comfort.
141.context: NodeContext: Amused by the player's gallows humour, in spite of herself

124.speaker: Player
124.text: If it's any consolation, I think you did the right thing.

254.speaker: Shadowheart
254.text: You're lucky to have such confidence. Me... I think the full price of what I've done has yet to reveal itself. I'm a target to Lady Shar's followers now.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I never thought you'd actually defy Shar. What was going through your head?

242.speaker: Shadowheart
242.text: When Nightsong mentioned wolves, I felt my heart freeze. She knows things about me. She has the answer, and I don't even know the question yet.

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: I know. It doesn't make much sense, does it? A whole lifetime of faith, of service... all gone, because of a few words from a stranger...

188.speaker: Shadowheart
188.text: Until I hear what Nightsong has to say for herself, I simply won't know if I've ruined everything for no reason.

341.speaker: Shadowheart
341.text: Be honest... what do you think of the new look?
341.context: NodeContext: A little nervous. Revealing a new hairstyle

289.speaker: Shadowheart
289.text: I thought I knew who I was... but I was wrong. I do not belong to Shar, and I do not want to be adorned like one of her puppets any longer.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: You came to mind as well. I remembered that night, when you resisted your impulses, turned away from what was demanded of you.

238.speaker: Shadowheart
238.text: I thought perhaps that if you could take a step towards the light, then I could try as well.

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: You came to mind as well. You turned from your queen, and found new purpose. I thought perhaps I might be able to do the same.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: The hair is just a gesture, true, but everything has a first step.

271.speaker: Shadowheart
271.text: An unexpected benefit of my training. Any novice knows how to source the right herbs and mixtures to alter one's hair

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: Typically reserved for disguises and subterfuge rather than self-discovery, but I don't live by Shar's rules any longer.

366.speaker: Player
366.text: If it helps you put the past behind you, I'm all for it.

298.speaker: Shadowheart
298.text: I'm glad... though I don't think I'm quite done with the past yet. Not until I've been to Baldur's Gate.

307.speaker: Shadowheart
307.text: Well, I'm glad someone does. Perhaps I'll get used to it. I have a lot to get used to, right now.

350.speaker: Player
350.text: Not for me - but who cares?

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: Honest of you - I can appreciate that, after being lied to by Shar for so long.

322.speaker: Shadowheart
322.text: Give it time. It may grow on you.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I like it. You seem to be growing closer to the Moonmaiden's light by the moment.

224.speaker: Shadowheart
224.text: Don't get your hopes up. I'm not exactly keen to throw my lot in with another goddess after what happened last time.

363.speaker: Shadowheart
363.text: I... I think so, yes. Perhaps I shouldn't put it to the test, but compared to everyone else, I feel fine. Better than fine.

183.speaker: Shadowheart
183.text: Do you know what this means? I must be blessed. Lady Shar is protecting me where others are left to face her wrath.

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: She loves me. She must do.

323.speaker: Shadowheart
323.text: You're resourceful - you'll find a way. Don't give me that look. It's a good thing that I'm resistant to the shadows - this way I can help you.
323.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sceptical reaction from the player after SH's first line. Back to SH right after, looking defensive.NodeContext: A little defensive on the second sentence (reacting to player's displeased look)

327.speaker: Player
327.text: Don't get carried away - this could be something else.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: Carried away? Hardly - the proof is right there. Just be grateful someone can handle this place.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: So what does all this mean?

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: Lady Shar wouldn't bless me like this for no reason - there must be something she wants of me.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Those signs we found, about Dark Justiciars... perhaps they were no coincidence. In either case, I need to watch for any place dedicated to Lady Shar. A temple, perhaps.

208.speaker: Shadowheart
208.text: This isn't the first sign we've come across of a Sharran presence. I'm not sure I can keep ignoring them.

294.speaker: Shadowheart
294.text: Have you ever heard of the Dark Justiciars? They were Lady Shar's most elite warriors. I can't explain why, but something about this reminds me of them.

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: I need to watch for any place dedicated to Lady Shar. A temple, perhaps. I need to know if there's more to this.

273.speaker: Shadowheart
273.text: The Shadowfell, her domain, has power here. Whatever the Dark Lady needs of me, I'll wager the answer lies wherever her power is strongest. I need to find that place, and see what awaits me.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Why you? I honour the Dark Lady, but the shadows do not spare me.

218.speaker: Shadowheart
218.text: I... I don't know. I'm sorry. It's not for me to guess what value Lady Shar places on each servant.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: Don't be concerned. Perhaps she'll present you with an opportunity to prove yourself. If I can find myself in her graces, you must have at least an equal chance.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Your mistress rewards you with survival against her own corrupt power? That's not love.

166.speaker: Shadowheart
166.text: The darkness is the truth, Selûnite. In the end, there will only be endless black, and those that Lady Shar has embraced.

246.speaker: Shadowheart
246.text: Cling to your torches and memories of the sun if you like - see how long you last without me.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: First time I've been out of my element in the dark.

209.speaker: Shadowheart
209.text: This is no cavern - this is true darkness. Perhaps Lady Shar will show you a path to her embrace, if you are worthy.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: You worship Shar? Why have you been keeping this from me?

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: Why? Safety, discretion, to keep us focused... need I go on?

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: In any case, we can talk about it later. It's the protection I have that matters right now.

367.speaker: Shadowheart
367.text: This must mean she is protecting me - she favours me... and you don't even know what I mean, do you? Time to come clean I suppose.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: I worship Shar, the Dark Lady, Mistress of the Night. Though honestly I'm surprised you didn't figure it out by yourself already...
12.context: NodeContext: Confessing a secret, but also slightly critical of the player's obliviousness

279.speaker: Shadowheart
279.text: And this means I must have her blessing. Lady Shar is protecting me where others are left to face her wrath.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: I wanted to talk to you about that. Lady Shar has bestowed a great honour upon me... but it isn't without a cost, it seems.

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: She expects me to fill my heart up with love for her alone, leaving no room for others. No room for us.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What we have... it could be the beginning of something special. Don't throw that away.

280.speaker: Shadowheart
280.text: I... I don't want to, but Lady Shar demands it. Everything is surrendered to her, ultimately. But she claims some things earlier than others, it seems.
280.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

313.speaker: Shadowheart
313.text: Perhaps we'll still be able to find a way. Some interpretation of her will that let's us stay together. But I can't guarantee anything, and I suspect that she'll demand more and more of me, as time passes.
313.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

151.speaker: Shadowheart
151.text: If you don't want to gamble on that, I understand. You'll have little trouble finding a more straightforward lover, I suspect.
151.context: NodeContext: Conflicted. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Trust me - if I wanted straightforward, I wouldn't be seeking to woo you in the first place.

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: Are you sure? I don't want you to resent my divided affections...
162.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I appreciate your honesty. This isn't an easy matter to broach.

234.speaker: Shadowheart
234.text: You mean a lot to me - it would be cruel to mislead you. Now what is it to be...?
234.context: NodeContext: Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I want whatever we can still share.

352.speaker: Shadowheart
352.text: Then I can only hope Lady Shar will prove lenient if I try to keep a little piece of my heart from her...
352.context: NodeContext: Pleased but also nervous. At risk of upsetting her goddess with sacrilegious romance. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

360.speaker: Player
360.text: Perhaps this is it for us then. I'll still cherish our time together.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: As will I. Lady Shar may have honoured me, but I think it was you who changed me.
36.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: Surely she'll allow that - Shar has shown great faith in you.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Shar must have bigger concerns, no?

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I understand. You have a calling now. I won't get in your way.

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.text: If you're truly sure. I'm not even certain myself...

169.speaker: Player
169.text: This is ridiculous - Shar can't force you to end things with me.

202.speaker: Shadowheart
202.text: No, I can remain with you as an ally if nothing else, but beyond that, I'm not sure how much I can promise you.

349.speaker: Shadowheart
349.text: Indeed. And already I have seen to some of her holy work - the apostate Ketheric Thorm is dead. He stole Lady Shar's powers to extend his profane life. No more.

226.speaker: Shadowheart
226.text: And her church in Baldur's Gate has been cleansed - Viconia strayed too far, and convinced herself that she knew better than the Nightsinger. The arrogance.
226.context: NodeContext: Sigh/small shake of the head on 'the arrogance'. Can't fathom how Shar's followers dare to stray

276.speaker: Shadowheart
276.text: There will be more for me to do, no doubt. The holy work will not be done until the Nightsinger's eternal darkness is restored.

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: She has - and I must continue to prove myself worthy of her favour. The apostate Ketheric Thorm still lives. That will soon change, if I have any say in the matter.

235.speaker: Shadowheart
235.text: Lady Shar's church in Baldur's Gate has yet to be cleansed. A rot has set in amongst the leadership - one that I must cut out.

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.text: Even once all that is done, more will be asked of me, no doubt. The holy work will not be done until the Nightsinger's eternal darkness is restored.

90.speaker: Shadowheart
90.text: There is one other matter. As the Chosen of Lady Shar, it is time to carry myself like one.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: I still carry certain vestiges of a novice. That will no longer do. If I am to lead in Lady Shar's name, I must look the part.

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: Leave it to me - you'll see exactly what I mean, soon enough.

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: Not just what I like - what Lady Shar demands of me.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Sounds drastic. Need I be concerned?

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: Don't worry. It's nothing that will bring you harm.
